title: Mastering Cursor for Enterprise: Effective Indexing & Cursor Ignore Techniques
author: Kyle Tran

key_facts: FACT: Cursor indexing can be reset by deleting the index and re-computing it to improve file detection and directory embedding.
FACT: Deleting the index does not delete any actual code files or sensitive data, only the internal reference structure.
FACT: The cursor ignore feature prevents AI from accessing or indexing specified files like .env files.
FACT: Cursor ignore can be configured through settings under 'indexing and docs' in the cursor configuration panel.
FACT: The AI chat panel can generate a cursor ignore file using natural language prompts such as 'help me create a cursor ignore file'.
FACT: The AI can automatically include variants of file patterns (e.g., all .env files) when generating ignore rules.
FACT: Once ignored, files like .env and README.md cannot be added to context or read by cursor's AI features.
FACT: The indexing process completes at 100% and includes 837 files in the demo codebase named 'broadcom'.
FACT: File name changes or missing detections can be resolved via syncing or reindexing the codebase.
FACT: Cursor's AI features are disabled for files listed in the cursor ignore file, enhancing security.
key_opinions: OPINION: Using cursor ignore is essential for enterprise engineers to protect API keys and sensitive IP files from exposure.
OPINION: The AI-powered cursor ignore generation simplifies complex file exclusion tasks without requiring technical knowledge.
OPINION: Reindexing acts as a reliable 'restart button' to fix broken or incomplete indexing issues.
OPINION: The natural language interface for creating ignore rules makes privacy management accessible to non-experts.
OPINION: Integrating ignore rules directly into the workflow improves both security and developer productivity.
key_datapoints: DATA: 837 files were indexed across the 'broadcom' folder during the demo.
DATA: Indexing completion status reached 100% in the demonstration.
DATA: The AI agent used was Claw 3.7 for generating the cursor ignore file.
DATA: .env files and README.md were successfully excluded from indexing after configuration.
DATA: AI features were disabled for all files listed in the cursor ignore file.
